This Character is a Norse Giant! Known as the Jutnar!
This Character is a Titan! The Gods of old, but is now under the commands of the Olympic Gods!
This Character is half Norse Giant, half Man!
This Character has the blood of the Jutnar in them!

I reject the cultures of the gods!
Your Nordic ways are spreading! The mortals are beginning to model themselves after you.
Your Olympian ways are spreading! The mortals are beginning to model themselves after you.
Fusing Light with Life you have the ability to create Angels when you wish!
Fusing Darkness with Life you have the ability to create Dark Angels when you wish!
Create the famous Norse Giants of old, a Jotunn!
Create the famous Norse Giants of old, a Jotunn!
Only Good gods exist.  This setting turns off auto-conversion to Evil religion and Evil God.
Send an angelic host to assist [Root.GetFullName] with [Root.GetHersHis] wars.
You raise your arms wide, and the golden note of a clarion sounds in the distance. The heralds of your angelic host ride forth to battle!
My followers shall know their protectors are Legion.
An army of my angels to crush the unbelievers!
March in vast array, that none still standing shall doubt my glory.
Let the world tremble with the boots of my angels!
Create a relic imbued with your divine energy.
What manner of divine relic shall you create?
This blade burns eternally with divine fire.
This axe glows with an otherworldly light.
This hammer, when thrown, can carry its wielder great distances.
This spear hums with the universe's unrealized potential.
This shield protects its bearer from all mortal sources of harm.
This symbol bears an ancient God-Name, carved in the divine script of elder days.
This horn plays music as beautiful as the bounty it provides its bearer.
This ring bestows shapeshifting powers on its bearer.
A sword, forever burning with divine glory.
A mighty axe, forged in divine fire.
There is no greater symbol of divinity than a weighty hammer. And let it fly!
A spear which can pierce the very heavens!
A shield of faith, to protect from all attacks.
A perfect sign of divine grace.
A hero's horn, useful in both peace and war.
